name: qt
review:
It is rather orange but usually covers well. With the powder I use it stays on pretty well. I have had problems with this concealer creasing and melting because of my oily skin but a little extra powder in problem areas helps a lot.
However, I have fallen asleep in this concealer and it did not stay on. Definitely doesn't last 24 hours. With good setting powder it can last a solid 8 without looking gross though.

name: JustJ
review: I use this for an everyday under eye concealer. I've had a lot of trouble finding an affordable concealer that is both pale and cool enough for my skin, but this is working well! It's not as creamy as a high end product, but if you're on a budget this works well for everyday.

name: Brittany
review: Didn't stay good at all

name: Brandie
review: After wearing this concealer for an hour (under my foundation) it oxidized and turned dark so I had dark circles that I didn't even have before I put it on! I had to go home and wash it off. Worst concealer I've ever used

name: Makeup lover
review: I use as a base under my eyes before i apply ben nye banana powder.

name: Sasha
review: My best friend,  lol.

name: Sidney
review: I love the colorstay foundation for the coverage but this concealer was extremely disappointing.

name: Princess
review: My mom wanted to try this. I did her makeup. It was great for her. It covered up her dark circles under her eyes,blemishes,and other no fun spots on her face. She loved it and was surprised on how well it worked for her. She has dry skin.

name: none
review: Good to apply before make up for covering under eye circles and facial brown spots.

name: wildts
review: This just would not blend. There is nothing worse than putting concealer under your eyes and just looking like a two toned ghost..... no amount of dabbing helped....

name: B
review: I typically buy the brand name concealer but decided to try this one and was pleasantly surprised. It went on smoothly, coverage was good, and matched my skin tone well. The only con I found is that after some hours of wear, the color fades (and unveiled some of my hyper pigmentation.) Easy fix is to apply more. Price point is great and I will be purchasing again for daily use.

name: Bev
review: I liked the product very well.

name: Fair-skinned Maid
review: I intended to use this product for covering blemishes, however I found that no amount of reapplying the product would hide them (specifically those that are raised). I would not recommend this product for use on small targeted spots, but rather for larger areas that are smoother like the under-eye area. I also recommend using with a powder because the product tends to be very dewy and sticky.

name: SolaraJ
review: I use this concealer as foundation, it blends so well.  Sometimes I add a tiny bit of Becca shimmer to get a completely natural look.  Either way, it is a great foundation or just concealer!

name: Ref
review: I have used it for s couple of years. I like how it covers under my eyes and age spots

name: Little Lin
review: Definitely use this product with a wet beauty blender if you want it to blend easily. Also put a little on and blend it immediately because it dries fast if it isn't a thick layer. Also has a smell like that of acrylic paint, but it goes away after blending it in.

name: April
review:
I use this for under eye bags, and blemish coverage.
It blends well, and is easy to use.

name: Natalee
review: I got the lightest shade because it matches me but as soon as I got home and searched it, it was literally a few shades darker than what I saw in the tube. I've never seen that before so I returned it the same day.

name: dee's screat weapon
review: product goes on smoothly and conceals well with the medicine for acne it's really great.

name: Amanda
review: I wasn't big on concealer till last year. This was the first one I bought but I wanted to test out different ones also. I bought two more and ended up hating them and went right back to the Revlon Color Stay. I'm already on my second bottle too. It blends in very well and it's not a heavy concealer. The color matches my skin perfectly. The only downside is that it does not last the whole day. It will get me through a full school day which is 6-7 hours but it does not really last much more then that. Usually I will have to reapply later in the day if I put it on in the morning and then I'm going out somewhere later. Other then that I love it and I will keep buying it!

name: Lauren
review: I use this concealer everyday under my eyes, on blemishes, and around my mouth.  I don't use foundation, just the concealer in those areas and it blends perfectly. Love this product.

name: Sophia
review: I am very disapointed with this product. I am an NC45 in Mac or a mix of Toast and Caramel in Revlon colorstay foundation so when I was looking through the concealers they offer they only had one for dark skin tones. I assumed because they had such great foundation that the concealer would go great with the foundation I already have. I was wrong the concealer I got was in the color deep and it looks grey on my skin. I put it under my eyes and on some blemishes and it's too dark for me but the next lightest one is too light so they don't make a concealer for someone they make foundation for. Even if this was the correct color this is a horrible concealer because it is too shear and easily wipes off because its so greasy.

name: Dallas Alice
review: Good product

name: Frostymeadows
review: I purchased this because it looked like it would be long wearing, and it is. I use it to cover a scar, and sometimes puffy eyes or other imperfections. It lasts but it does not cover as well as other products I have used.

name: Rachelle
review: I use this concealer under my eyes and on blemishes. It covers well and the coverage stays throughout the day. Very happy with this product!

name: Rebecca
review: This concealer covers my dark under eye circles very well.  It also stays put for an entire day! I have tried many brands to find a concealer that hides circles effectively and doesn't wear off, and I'm lucky to have stumbled upon this gem! Use a bit of powder on top and don't touch your face during the day, and this concealer stays put!

name: Noel Day
review: I like to use this product under my eyes after I apply my foundation.  I like that it really brightens my under eyes.  I don't like how much work it takes to get it to blend well, but it will eventually.

name: Nikki
review: Covers well and provides a good selection of colors for matching.

name: AleighLo
review: I didn't really care for this product. It didn't blend well with my color stay foundation. I only used it once and haven't used it since.

name: Katherine
review: Need a product that would cover blemishes I am 52 and  broke out after I came back from Mexico.

name: gracie
review: I wasn't too impressed with this but it wasn't too bad either. It just doesn't really cover that well in the first place and doesn't stay either. It's also really liquidy and I prefer something creamier.

name: Noel Day
review: I used this under my eyes, and as my highlight for my bridal photos and I loved it.  It looked so natural and it stayed matte and didn't clup or crease.

name: Audrey
review: I love this concealor! It covers well, stays on for a few hours, and is a nice color if you get the right one. You'll have to carry it in your purse if you want all-day coverage though, and you're better off using light foundation under eyes. It's great for blemishes and such though!

name: Arrielle
review: this is a great concealer. Unlike high end brands that all come pritty much in yellow shades, Revlon has a variety of nuances..

name: minnie
review:
Under Eyes
The product comes out on the applicater in a giant
blob...

name: neise
review: really like acne healing benefits but blending into skin is hard. you can see the color is slightly different from normal skin color.

name: JennyGirl
review: I have used this as my concealer for years. It blends well, stays on, and does not settle into lines. My fav for life!!

name: Nina
review: I would have liked the fair to be even lighter so I could use it as a contour since I am fair skinned. It was a great color to blend with the rest of my foundation

name: kelleylovesboots
review:
I discovered this in high school when I needed a concealer for blemishes. After trying all the other drugstore brands with mediocre success, I tried this. It was a bit more expensive than the others, but it WORKED. You need to apply it in very thin layers, sometimes even using a q-tip for blending, but this will cover any blemish, broken capillary or spot.

I would not use it as an under eye concealer because it really dries out and would emphasize any fine lines. It is not a moisturizing formula. It stays put on oily or combo skin, and it does a great job, but not for under eyes.

Seriously, this was a life changer when I disovered it and I am still using it about 15 years later. Now that is staying power!

name: Ashritha
review: Love it

name: Jill
review: Bought because it was 'waterproof' but it comes off with the first tear.

name: Kelly Rose
review: This is the worst product ever. Do Not Purchase This Concealer!! I have extremely sensitive skin and rosatia and when I put this under my eyes it felt like it was burning on my skin. It doesn't cover any blemishes, and if you have sensitive skin and rosatia it will sting and burn your skin terribly like it did to mine. I am not sure if I am allergic to an ingredient in this product, but it is terrible and a waste of money.

name: Jaz
review: I've been searching for an everyday concealer to replace my favorite NARS radiant creamy concealer and this is it! For an everyday concealer it works great and last throughout a full 8 hour work day without creasing or separating! Perfect for a subtle under eye highlight!

name: deliosinta
review: I've only used this concealer a couple times and so far it's working great! Underneath my eyes are quite dark but this covered it perfectly, I look much more awake and it still looks fairly natural on my skin.

name: angelkyz
review: The applicator makes for easy application. Blends very well.

name: Kate
review:
I have used this product over several different moisturizers, and it stays smooth- no
under eye creasing.

name: Beth
review: Amazing for my undereye circles.  Grest coverage without creasing or settling in wrinkles.

name: Jean the dancing machine
review: Blends well with my complexion.

name: KML
review: I use it for dark circles as needed.

name: Mercedes
review: I really like it, is smooth and easy to apply.

name: Rach
review: I would have liked the concealer if it didn't crease after an hour of wear. I even set it, so dissapointed. I returned it.

name: Leann
review: Even after setting it, it disappears.

name: kaymichelle
review: I got this concealer not so long ago, when I put it on for the first time it looked nice on the skin. But just after 30 minutes of wear it looked like I didn't even put it one. Not the best concealer, wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

name: Mirrored soul
review: Concealer is one product I can't live without but this concealer didn't make me feel like it was doing a good job. I'm very acne prone and I wanted a concealer able to hide my dark spots and acne bumps

name: M
review: I have spent quite a bit on many brands of concealers trying to find one that will compliment my skin and not draw attention to the fine lines around my eyes that come with age.  I am almost 50 and am finding that the older I get, the harder it is to find product to help improve my skin tone that feels good on my face and doesn't draw more attention to the laugh lines that have been gracefully earned around my eyes ;-).  This is a wonderful product.

name: Boots Bean
review: I hadn't gotten into legit makeup until recently, 16 years with drug store makeup did me well. even though I'm buying nicer, more quality makeup, I will still continue to purchase this concealer.

name: NRB
review: Good concealer that is easy to apply. Can be a little dry on dry skin. But overall good! Very good coverage. And I love that it is so easy to apply. I use a sponge to blend it in. Works perfectly.

name: Lo
review: I love everything about it

name: Sueh
review: Cover up

name: Angela the mom
review: It burns my skin

name: Freckles
review: Love this concealer!  I have some sun damage which translates to redness (similar to rosacea) & dark spots. This concealer covers both very well in just one coat. I dab it on with the sponge tip applicator and blend it with my fingers. One coat covers perfectly.

name: CaityVanityy
review: THIS WAS SUCH A LETDOWN. I really liked the formula and how it felt on my skin, and it really blended well, and really covered up my spots, but after one day it broke me out :(( wouldn't recommend to acne prone skin at all!

name: Kate O
review: VERY thin product. As soon as I put it on my blemishes, my skin soaks it in, and I have to put on another coat, then another coat, and another... By that point, it's still not full coverage. I put my face powder on afterwards, hoping that will cover the rest, but it makes it SO obvious I'm wearing a ton of concealer. I'm returning this product as soon as I'm finished typing this.

name: Tiff
review:
Overall, I like this concealer. It does work for both under eyes and blemishes, but I prefer it for blemishes and spots. I use the Revlon whipped creme makeup and I love it, for many reasons so I wanted to try the concealer to see if i would have good luck with that too.. (I wear the "natural beige" makeup, and got the concealer in "light" for under eyes and "light medium" for face spots and they work well together!) I am happy because I often have a difficult time finding a good color match.

I prefer this type of applicator for concealers, it feels like it is easy to put the right amount where I want it. I am confident I can put it in my little purse size makeup bag without it making a mess.

I have no complaints on the blemish and spot coverage. I am prone to flakiness- I am happy to say, this concealer doesn't dry me out and cause the flakes. I dot it on all the areas I want to cover, then use a brush to blend it, and its like my face, without the spots.

It covers my dark under eye circles well and doesn't dry me out. It creases a little at first, especially if I use it on my lids to correct the color there since I get darker on the inner corners (but honestly, most concealers in that area do crease a little) I feel like it takes awhile to set on my eye area. The up side to that is it is easy to blend and doesn't set too quickly...For some, you could probably remedy this with a setting powder. I prefer to use a setting spray since i have combination dry/ acne prone skin; powders make me look dry and cling to blemishes- they look flaky and worse than they did before makeup.

name: Em
review: A couple days ago I put this concealer on and it looked flawless what I put it on and half way through the day it turned into noticeable orange spots on my face. I tried it again to see if I did something to make it go like that but it happened again and again and again.

name: ashley
review: conceals well and so easy to apply will be buying this again

name: JD423
review: It's probably the thickest concealer I own, but as a result, it gives really great coverage.

name: yobri
review: I absolutely love Revlon ColorStay foundation (whipped and regular) so I figured this would be just as great. WRONG! It's very easy to apply and there's a lot of product in the bottle but it doesn't blend well. Once I pat it into my skin, it settles in the creases immediately. After an hour, it breaks into sections on my face where you can see patches of concealer all over my under eyes. It also dries me out, especially on my forehead and above my eyebrows. I don't have oily nor dry skin, it is normal and I have found that my skin type is very compatible with a lot of makeup. I find myself trying to get my moneys worth using it again and again knowing that it's just going to ruin my face makeup. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. I feel like concealer will either be a hit or miss. Spend your money well elsewhere on concealer.

name: Sharon
review: I use for undereye circles and occasional blemishes. I prefer this type of applicator because goes on easily.

name: dawn
review: only problem i had with this product was the smell. it smelt like a dead cockroach stuck in water. other wise the application and color was great. i only used it for my under eyes, basically to highlight my face.

name: crimsonrose51
review: Great coverage. Easy to use. Easy to color match to my skin tone (very fair). Long lasting. Available for purchase at a lot of stores. However I don't like the applicator. If I touch applicator to an acne blemish then dip it into the concealer, it could get bacteria into the container. I deposit the amount of concealer to the back of my hand and apply with a concealer brush to avoid bacteria contamination.

name: Nicolec_
review: I use this product to highlight. I apply it in the morning and by the end of the day it still look great. I think this is a good product for a drugstore brand.

name: Vicky
review: There is nothing to rave about this product!

name: Marina
review: I have a strong dislike for revlon products. I feel like Revlon tries really hard to make a good product but then comes out with a really terrible one. this concealer is sheer which can be expected. Luckily it's just my exact skin color so I apply it as a triangle and then use a beauty blender to soften the edges of it then I set it really quickly for extra coverage around my dark circles. As a spot or discoloration concealer is better rather and an under concealer

name: Nicole Adair
review: I got this thinking it might to as well as Revlon's ColorStay foundation.. And was pretty disappointed. Creases really bad under the eyes. May be better for spot covering.

name: Shann
review: This covers well but does not blend easily. It eventually blend with a lot of effort.

name: Emma
review: This honestly was just okay. It didn't stay very well if your going to exercise all day. The light is also really tan for my skin, so I kind of looked weird with it on. This also really didn't conceal acne well and that disappointed me.

name: Venusprime
review: I bought this to use for contouring as it is a deeper shade. It works great!

name: sparklesweetie
review: The applicator is horrible, the concealer itself is watery and it doesn't dry easily. Total waste of money! Try maybelline fit me concealer.

name: Sam
review: Horrible pigmentation, you could add four layers and nothing would show up. Leaves my under eyes looking very clumpy and cakey, and makes my skin look dry.

name: Ella
review: I did not like this product because when i wore in through out the day it only stuck to my dry patches and did not stay on anywhere else, it also had very poor coverage, I have medium acne and it covered nothing.

name: Ally
review: Goes on easy and smooth!

name: Lou
review: Use to remove dark circles under my eyes. And also to highlight my brows

name: Stella Jean
review: I use this concealer to cover my imperfections and I use it to highlight under my eyes. I love it but it gives a slight sting every time I apply.

name: DM
review: I absolutely love the colorstay foundation and have used it for years so I figured I'd like this concealer! Absolutely hated it. Worst concealer I've ever used. Once I blended it, it literally disappeared. No coverage and no color stayed on whatsoever once blended.

name: Rachel makeup addict
review: Made my pores HUGE! Never seen a product do such a thing before. I guess it settled in my pores.

name: Olivia Begnel
review: This concealer has to be one of the best concealers i have ever had(&Ive had A LOT). I have extremely dark  circles, and this completely cover everything!! There colors have more of a yellow tone, but the fairest color isn't too yellow.

name: La Patrona
review: I loved it. It's the Percocet coverage

name: Lila
review: I like how it goes on and is easily blended with makeup.

name: KileyB
review: didn't cover well at all and I'm a big fan of of the coverstay.

name: Lisa
review:
Other than a beauty blender I couldn't find the right brush to blend it with and came out a little blotchy with my fingers that's the annoying part because then it creases
But with a beauty blender and setting it it works greats

name: Cass
review: Covers what little under eye circles I have and a few spots pretty well.

name: Skylarmakeupartistry
review: This is not the best product at all! I've tried many times to like this product but I just can't seem to like it. It doesn't last all day. It's creases even after it is set. It settles into fine lines. There's just nothing good about this concealer.

name: Tina
review: I liked it

name: naz
review: This concealer was not that long lasting, since it has a sheer light formula that is not thick, it will crease if you apply too much under your eyes, BUT it  is perfect for highlighing the bridge of your nose, and highlighting your face and it will look gorgeous once set with a long lasting loose poweder! I give it a 8/10 since it is not long lasting, BUT it can be if you do add powder on top.

name: Abi:)
review: I love this concealer! Covers my dark circles very easily and stays on for as long as I need it too and I don't even have to set it with powder. It also works as an eyeshadow primer. The only thing I don't like about it is it doesn't cover acne very well and will come off quickly on pimples.

name: Phoebe
review: Not 24 hour coverage... Doesn't even stay on for 10 minutes after applying it. It wipes right off. It's too liquidy for anything besides under the eye concealer.

name: Susan
review: I have fair skin and asked the customer service associate her opinion. She suggested one shade darker. Better to go 2 shades. One shade darker covers but is noticeable

name: jazzibear
review: i use it to high light the forehead,under eyes,down the center of the nose....don't need to spend more.very good product

name: Tanya
review: I bought this as an under eye concealer.  It did seem to cover well when applied. I didn't like that it felt like it never dried and the moistness from it caused my mascara to transfer during the day.  This would probably work for someone who sets concealer with a powder.  I have another concealer that does better and dries to a satin finish so this just went in the trash.

name: nnnniicole
review:
-blends well
-a lighter coverage
-yellow undertone
-good for highlighting
-lightweight

name: Miss Kelly Renee
review:
When I get this concealer in the right color, it blends just fine. I have no issues with it.
However, I accidentally got one that was too light for me and decided to repurpose it for a highlight shade. However, it looks super cakey and it feels heavy as well as makes my skin tingle. Granted, that tinglyness goes away but yeah, it sure doesn't feel great.
I don't think I will buy this again, but I don't hate it.

name: Robyn
review: This is fine as an under-eye concealer. The problem is that is is very moist or oily or something, and after only a couple of hours I end up with big smudges of mascara under my eyes.  This doesn't happen with the other concealers I use. Maybe if you wore water-proof mascara, it would be OK.

name: Annette55
review: I use mostly for under eye circles. It works a swell as any other concealer that I've used. It has a a convenient sponge applicator, although my personal preference is a brush. Up close you can see that it settles in creases, but an overall better appearance than those dark purple circles!

name: Tabatha
review: I usually love all the color stay products and this one was a miss...sorry I made the purchase

name: ally
review: I wanted to love this product, but I was horribly disappointed. I cannot keep it from creasing under my eyes. I've tried using primer, and setting it with powder but nothing works. However I have found myself using it for highlighting elsewhere (my nose, cheekbones, forehead, etc.) and it works well for that. If you're looking for a well rounded or under eye concealer, this is not for you.

name: Dancer
review: Very good product.

name: Miki
review: It's easy to blend and apply. I mainly use it for my dark circle. But it doesn't cover well. Will not repurchase.

name: sf
review: Very nice, smooth, easily blendable. Very nice product, but doesn't completely cover the dark circles under my eyes

name: Dustie Rain
review: I put it everywhere a concealer should go. Under my eyes, on my nose and forehead, and on my acne. I have to use SO MUCH product.

name: Do not have one.
review: I have used it for a while.

name: JustaGirlWhoLikestoFeelPrettySometimes
review: I tend to try different foundation/concealer combinations constantly because I have very oily skin and by the end of the day my face is melting off. I've tried everything from "for oily skin" to "acne clearing" to expensive "clay" foundations/concealers. Whether those are selling tactics or they flat out don't work, I have yet to find a concealer that does the job without caking or being too see through. I don't wear a lot of make up, but I do like to look complete. This concealer does that for me. It's a thicker, tackier, but VERY blend-able formula. It gives a full coverage look without being too heavy. I apply with a wet blender and it works great. No creasing or caking. I recommend giving this product a try. My Ulta is discontinuing certain colors so I hope that doesn't mean they're eliminating it completely. Hard to find inexpensive beauty products.

name: Mel
review: It's good

name: Emma
review: Once you apply it over your foundation (which I used the Revlon Colorstay Foundation), it seems to work well at first. It blends well into the skin and the applicator was easy to work with. Then a couple hours later, it's like you never put it on. I put it under my eyes, the bridge of my nose, my chin, and on my forehead. All of that was gone and you could only see very obvious clumps around my nose, where my skin gets very dry. My skin was well moisturized and primed beforehand, and I even tried this concealer a couple more times. I tried baking with loose translucent powder, I tried setting it with pigmented press powder that matched my skin tone, and nothing worked. I would not recommend this if you have dry skin.

name: Ris
review: This isn't a good cover up, I used it for under my eyes and it didn't cover. Poor coverage. Wouldn't get again.

name: Kylie
review: It's the only concealer that truly matches my skin, similar to the color stay foundation. I like it for under eyes and concealing pimples.

name: MeganMarie
review: I've been trying lots of concealers. I think so far this one is one of my favs for the price you get a good product.

name: MelMel
review: Hmph. Thought this was going to be a great concealer based on other reviews but I found it completely unblendable.  Didn't hide anything and made my under eye area feel really dry.  I did return this product.

name: LT
review: I really like this concealer. The only issue that I had with it was that it wouldn't stay on over some blemishes but for the most part, it stayed on everywhere and blended great. I'm an athlete and it even stayed on during my games.
